member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.FormattedIO.MessageBasedFormattedIO
member.summary: The MessageBasedFormattedIO implements the IMessageBasedFormattedIO interface, and includes methods that format and parse data to/from instrument formats, and manage the formatted I/O read and write buffers needed to do itefficiently. It correctly handles line termination and buffer flushing. When writing to an instrument, Formatted I/O makes it possible to easily send complete and correct instrument commands. When reading from an instrument, Formatted I/O makes it possible to easily read and parse complete responses.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.FormattedIO.MessageBasedFormattedIO.#ctor(Ivi.Visa.IMessageBasedSession)
member.summary: Create an instance of the MessageBasedFormattedIO class which will delegate actual reads to and writes from the instrument to the raw I/O capabilities of the specified session object.
member.param: The session object to which actual reads to and writes from the instrument are delegated.

member.summary: Represents the status of each handler in the Conflict Manager record with respect to the HardwareInterface the handler is listed under.

member.summary: The handler is not the chosen handler for the HardwareInterface.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.ConflictManager.HandlerType.ChosenByResourceManager
member.summary: The resource manager chose this handler for the HardwareInterface. If the resource manager encounters an error when trying to use this handler at a later time, the resource manager can choose a different handler for this HardwareInterface.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.ConflictManager.HandlerType.ChosenByUser
member.summary: A user chose this handler for the HardwareInterface. If the resource manager encounters an error when trying to use this handler at a later time, the resource manager will not choose a different handler for this HardwareInterface.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.ConflictManager.FlushBehavior
member.summary: Describes the behavior to use when the FlushConflictFile() method saves Conflict Manager settings to the file on disk. This mode is ignored if the local in-memory copy of the data has not changed.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.ConflictManager.FlushBehavior.OverwriteAlways
member.summary: Even if there are changes to the file on disk, overwrite them.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.ConflictManager.FlushBehavior.WriteIfFileOnDiskUnchanged
member.summary: Save only if there are no changes to the file on disk. If the disk file is newer, FlushConflictFile() will throw an exception.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.ConflictManager.FlushBehavior.WriteOrReload
member.summary: Save only if there are no changes to the file on disk. If the disk file is newer, FlushConflictFile() will discard the local changes and reload the file from disk.

member.summary: Wait for events of type(s) specified by the argument.
member.param: The event type(s) for which the method will wait. This may be a custom event type.
member.returns: Event identification and status information. Clients must dispose the returned object when it is no longer needed.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.INativeVisaSession.WaitOnEvent(System.Int32,Ivi.Visa.EventQueueStatus@)
member.summary: Wait for events of type(s) specified by the argument.
member.param: The event type(s) for which the method will wait. This may be a custom event type.
The current state of the event queue when the method returns.
member.returns: Event identification and status information. Clients must dispose the returned object when it is no longer needed.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.INativeVisaSession.WaitOnEvent(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Wait for events of type(s) specified by the argument.
member.param: The event type(s) for which the method will wait. This may be a custom event type.

The maximum amount of time to wait for the event, in milliseconds. If the timeout is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), the operation will not block. If the timeout is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), the operation will not timeout.
member.returns: Event identification and status information. Clients must dispose the returned object when it is no longer needed.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.IOTimeoutException
member.summary: A VISA.NET I/O timeout has occured.

remarks.para: This exception is only used for specific I/O methods where a calling program might be able to reasonably recover in some circumstances. The VISA.NET specification identifies the methods that throw this exception if the I/O operation times out.
If the VISA.NET specfication does not specify that this exception may be thrown by a particular method, calling programs should expect a different timeout exception.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.IOTimeoutException.#ctor(System.Int64,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified value for the actual number of elements read or written.
member.param: The actual number of elements read or written before the timeout occurred. A value of -1 indicates that the actual number could not be determined.
The actual bytes read or written before the timeout occurred. If the actual number of elements read could not be determined, the array is empty.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.IOTimeoutException.#ctor(System.Int64,System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified value for the actual number of elements read or written and the specified message.
member.param: The actual number of elements read or written before the timeout occurred. A value of -1 indicates that the actual number could not be determined.
The actual bytes read or written before the timeout occurred. If the actual number of elements read could not be determined, the array is empty.
The message that describes the error.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.IOTimeoutException.#ctor(System.Int64,System.Byte[],System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified value for the actual number of elements read or written, the specified message, and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The actual number of elements read or written before the timeout occurred. A value of -1 indicates that the actual number could not be determined.
The actual bytes read or written before the timeout occurred. If the actual number of elements read could not be determined, the array is empty.
The message that describes the error.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference if no inner exception is specified.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.IOTimeoutException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.
member.param: The that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.IOTimeoutException.System#Runtime#Serialization#ISerializable#GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Sets the with information about the exception.

member.name: P:Ivi.Visa.IOTimeoutException.ActualCount
member.summary: The actual number of elements read or written before the timeout occurred. A value of -1 indicates that the actual number could not be determined.

member.name: P:Ivi.Visa.IOTimeoutException.ActualData
member.summary: The actual bytes read or written before the timeout occurred. If the actual number of elements read could not be determined, the array is empty.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.ResourceOpenStatus
member.summary: Indicates the success status of an open operation.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.ResourceOpenStatus.Unknown
member.summary: This value is used for an initial state, but will never be returned for a successful open operation.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.ResourceOpenStatus.Success
member.summary: The session opened successfully.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.ResourceOpenStatus.DeviceNotResponding
member.summary: The session opened successfully, but the device at the specified address did not respond.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.ResourceOpenStatus.ConfigurationNotLoaded
member.summary: The session opened successfully, but the specified configuration either does not exist or could not be loaded. The session will use VISA-specified defaults.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.ReadStatus
member.summary: Indicates the success status of a raw I/O read operation.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.ReadStatus.Unknown
member.summary: This value is used for an initial state, but will never be returned for a successful read operation.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.ReadStatus.EndReceived
member.summary: An END was received at the end of the read operation. This condition has the highest priority and is reported regardless of which of the other success conditions might also have occurred.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.ReadStatus.TerminationCharacterEncountered
member.summary: A termination character was received at the end of the read operation. This condition is reported even if the read operation also read the specified number of bytes.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.ReadStatus.MaximumCountReached
member.summary: The specified number of bytes was returned by the read operation. This condition has the lowest priority. There may or may not be more data available to be read.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.ResourceLockState
member.summary: Indicates the state of the VISA lock on the resource associated with this session.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.ResourceLockState.NoLock
member.summary: The resource is not locked.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.ResourceLockState.ExclusiveLock
member.summary: The resource is locked with an exclusive lock.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.ResourceLockState.SharedLock
member.summary: The resource is locked with a shared lock.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.IMessageBasedRawIO
member.summary: The IMessageBasedRawIO interface includes methods that read and write data to/from a device without trying to format or parse it. It also is capable of performing asynchronous I/O reads and writes with a flexible set of mechanisms for notifying the calling program that the asynchronous I/O operation is complete.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.RemoteLocalMode
member.summary: Specifies the local or remote mode into which to place the GPIB, TCPIP, or USB instrument.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.RemoteLocalMode.LocalWithoutLockout
member.summary: Send the GTL (Go To Local) command and deassert the REN (Remote ENable) interface line, putting it in LOCS (LOCal State).

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.RemoteLocalMode.Remote
member.summary: Assert the REN (Remote ENable) interface line and address the device. The instrument will go into either REMS (REMote State) or RWLS (Remote With Lockout State).

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.RemoteLocalMode.RemoteWithLocalLockout
member.summary: Address the device and send it an LLO (Local LockOut) command, putting it in the RWLS (Remote With Lockout State).

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.RemoteLocalMode.Local
member.summary: Send the GTL (Go To Local) command. The instrument will go into either LOCS (LOCal State) or LWLS (Local With Lockout State).

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.SerialTerminationMethod
member.summary: Indicates the method used to terminate Serial read and write operations.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.SerialTerminationMethod.None
member.summary: Indicates that reads will not terminate until all of the requested data is received (or an error occurs), and that writes will not append anything to the data being written.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.SerialTerminationMethod.HighestBit
member.summary: Indicates that reads will terminate as soon as a character arrives with its highest bit set, and writes will send all but the last character with the highest bit clear, then transmit the last character with the highest bit set.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.SerialTerminationMethod.TerminationCharacter
member.summary: Indicates that reads will terminate as soon as the current termination character has been received, and writes will send the current termination character after the last character has been sent.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.SerialTerminationMethod.Break
member.summary: Indicates that writes will transmit a break after the last character has been sent. Not valid for reads.

The trigger line to reserve.

member.summary: Reserve multiple trigger lines that the caller can then map and/or assert. This method will succeed only if it can reserve all of the bus/line pairs. If any of the bus/line pairs cannot be reserved, this method will not reserve any of them. Note that the and arrays are parallel: the lengths must be the same, and buses[n] corresponds to lines[n].
member.param: The trigger bus segments in which to reserve the triggers.
The trigger lines to reserve.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.VisaAsyncCallback

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.IVisaAsyncResult
member.summary: The interface that is used to communicate information about the progress and results of an asynchronous operation. The object that implements this interface specific to, and identifies, that particular operation.

member.name: P:Ivi.Visa.IVisaAsyncResult.IsAborted
member.summary: If true, the asynchronous I/O operation was aborted by a call to AbortRead() or AbortWrite().

member.name: P:Ivi.Visa.IVisaAsyncResult.Buffer
member.summary: For asynchronous write operations, the data buffer that contains the data to be written to the device. For asynchronous read operations, the content of the buffer is unspecified until the operation is complete (that is, after the call to EndRead has completed successfully. If the asynchronous operation was initiated with a user created buffer, this is that buffer.

member.name: P:Ivi.Visa.IVisaAsyncResult.Count
member.summary: Before the associated asynchronous operation has been completed by executing EndRead or EndWrite, the value of this property is undefined. After the associated asynchronous operation has been completed by executing EndRead or EndWrite, the value of this property is the actual number of bytes written (for a write operation) or the actual number of bytes read (for a read operation).

member.name: P:Ivi.Visa.IVisaAsyncResult.Index
member.summary: The value of the index argument for the method call that created this VISA asynchronous results object. If the method did not include an index, then 0.

member.summary: Assert the GPIB ATN line synchronously. If a data handshake is in progress, ATN will not be asserted until the handshake is complete.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.AtnMode.DeassertHandshake
member.summary: Deassert the GPIB ATN line, and then enter shadow handshake mode. The interface participates in data handshakes as an Acceptor without actually reading the data.

member.summary: Assert the GPIB ATN line asynchronously. This should only be used under error conditions.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.SerialFlowControlModes
member.summary: Indicates the type of flow control used by the Serial connection. Multiple flow control mechanisms may be specified, although certain combinations may not be supported by all serial ports and/or operating systems.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.SerialFlowControlModes.None
member.summary: The serial connection does not use flow control, and buffers on both sides of the connection are assumed to be large enough to hold all data transferred.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.SerialFlowControlModes.XOnXOff
member.summary: The serial connection uses the XON and XOFF characters to perform software flow control.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.SerialFlowControlModes.RtsCts
member.summary: The serial connection uses the RTS output signal and the CTS input signal to perform hardware flow control.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.SerialFlowControlModes.DtrDsr
member.summary: The serial connection uses the DTR output signal and the DSR input signal to perform hardware flow control.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.SerialParity
member.summary: Indicates whether parity checking is being used by the serial connection, and if so, how it is determined. The specified parity is used with every frame transmitted and received.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.SerialParity.None
member.summary: No parity bit is present.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.SerialParity.Odd
member.summary: The parity bit is set to 1 if the number of ones in data bits (not including the parity bit) is odd, and is otherwise set to 0.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.SerialParity.Even
member.summary: The parity bit is set to 1 if the number of ones in data bits (not including the parity bit) is even, and is otherwise set to 0.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.SerialParity.Mark
member.summary: The parity bit exists and is always 1.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.SerialParity.Space
member.summary: The parity bit exists and is always 0.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.SerialStopBitsMode
member.summary: Specifies the number of stop bits used to indicate the end of a Serial frame.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.SerialStopBitsMode.One
member.summary: One stop bit.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.SerialStopBitsMode.OneAndOneHalf
member.summary: One-and-one-half (1.5) stop bits.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.SerialStopBitsMode.Two
member.summary: Two stop bits.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.IMessageBasedFormattedIO
member.summary: The IMessageBasedFormattedIO interface includes methods that format and parse data to/from instrument formats, and manage the formatted I/O read and write buffers needed to do it efficiently. It correctly handles line termination and buffer flushing. When writing to an instrument, Formatted I/O makes it possible to easily send complete and correct instrument commands. When reading from an instrument, Formatted I/O makes it possible to easily read and parse complete responses.

member.name: P:Ivi.Visa.IMessageBasedFormattedIO.ReadBufferSize
member.summary: The size of the formatted I/O read buffer. This controls only the formatted I/O read buffer (the in-memory buffer used for storing data from the instrument before parsing it), not any kernel-mode device I/O buffers.

member.name: P:Ivi.Visa.IMessageBasedFormattedIO.WriteBufferSize
member.summary: The size of the formatted I/O write buffer. This controls only the formatted I/O write buffer (the in-memory buffer used for storing data to the instrument after formatting it), not any kernel-mode device I/O buffers.

member.name: P:Ivi.Visa.IMessageBasedFormattedIO.BinaryEncoding
member.summary: The binary encoding used by formatted I/O WriteBinaryBlock and ReadBinaryBlock methods to determine the array format.

member.name: P:Ivi.Visa.IMessageBasedFormattedIO.TypeFormatter
member.summary: A reference to an object that formats object values into a string equivalent (for Printf) and vice versa (for Scanf). This property must be set before the call to Printf or Scanf that expects to use it.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.IMessageBasedFormattedIO.DiscardBuffers
member.summary: Discard all of the data in both the formatted I/O read and write buffers without performing any I/O to or from the connected resource.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.IMessageBasedFormattedIO.FlushWrite(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Flushes all the data from the formatted I/O write buffer and sends it to the instrument, without appending a termchar.
member.param: Determines whether the END indicator is sent to the instrument. If the SendEndEnabled property is different from the value of the sendEnd parameter, the FlushWrite method changes the SendEndEnabled property on the I/O session, commits the write buffer, and then restores the previous value of the SendEndEnabled property.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.IMessageBasedFormattedIO.Write(System.Char)
member.summary: Converts the specified character to an ASCII character and appends it to the formatted I/O write buffer.
member.param: The character to be added to the formatted I/O write buffer.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.IMessageBasedFormattedIO.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified string to an ASCII string and appends it to the formatted I/O write buffer.
member.param: The string to be added to the formatted I/O write buffer.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.IMessageBasedFormattedIO.Write(System.Int64)
member.summary: Converts the specified signed integer to an ASCII string and appends it to the formatted I/O write buffer.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.IMessageBasedFormattedIO.ReadUntilMatch(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Read characters from the formatted I/O read buffer until one of the is matched.
member.param: A string that contains the characters to be matched to end the string.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.IMessageBasedFormattedIO.ReadUntilEnd
member.summary: Read characters from the formatted I/O read buffer until an END is received, including the character with the END indicator, treating them as a string. For protocols that do not support END, calling this method may result in a timeout or other implementation-specific behavior.
member.returns: The string read from the buffer.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.IMessageBasedFormattedIO.SkipString(System.String)
member.summary: Skip and discard the exact string specified by from the formatted I/O read buffer. Multiple whitespace characters in the read buffer may match a single whitespace in the data string. If contains a % character, the method throws an argument exception. If does not match the read buffer the method also throws an exception.
member.param: The string to be skipped and discarded from the formatted I/O read buffer.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.IMessageBasedFormattedIO.SkipUntilEnd
member.summary: Discards the entire formatted I/O read buffer. If the previous formatted I/O buffer did not include an END or termination character, this method reads from the device until an END or termination character is encountered and discards the data.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.IRegisterBasedSession
member.summary: IRegisterBasedSession is the base interface for VISA.NET register-based resources.
member.remarks: This interface uses signed types rather than unsigned types to maintain CLS compliance. The caller can cast signed values to unsigned values if needed.

member.name: P:Ivi.Visa.IRegisterBasedSession.AllowDma
member.summary: Specifies whether direct memory access is enabled. In some cases you may not be able to change whether DMA is enabled, so reading this property value may not return the same value that was set.

member.name: P:Ivi.Visa.IRegisterBasedSession.DestinationIncrement
member.summary: For MoveOut methods, specifies whether to do a block move or a FIFO write.

member.name: P:Ivi.Visa.IRegisterBasedSession.SourceIncrement
member.summary: For MoveIn methods, specifies whether to do a block move or a FIFO read.

member.name: P:Ivi.Visa.IVisaSession.TimeoutMilliseconds
member.summary: The I/O timeout in milliseconds for I/O communication on this resource session. If the timeout is VisaConstants.ImmediateTimeout (0), operations will never wait for the device to respond. If the timeout is VisaConstants.InfiniteTimeout (-1), I/O communication will not timeout.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.GlobalResourceManager
member.summary: The Global Resource Manager (GRM) uses resource names to locate resources and instantiate sessions to the resources. It resolves any overlapping functionality between vendor-specific VISA.NET implementations according to user-defined criteria (with reasonable defaults). It also provides methods for parsing resource names into their constituent data items.

member.summary: The version of this VISA.NET implementation.

member.summary: Find all of the VISA resources that match the specified .
member.param: The search pattern.
member.returns: All VISA resources matching the search .

member.summary: Parse the specified to get extended interface information.

member.returns: The detailed information derived by parsing the specified .

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.GlobalResourceManager.TryParse(System.String,Ivi.Visa.ParseResult@)
member.summary: Parse the specified to get extended interface information. If the Parse operation is not successful, this function returns instead of throwing an exception.
member.param: The VISA resource name.
The detailed information derived by parsing the specified .
member.returns: if the Parse operation was successful, otherwise.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.NativeVisaException
member.summary: An error related to the underlying VISA native C implementation has occurred. The status code indicates the type of error that occurred.
member.remarks: This exception should not be used for other than its intended purpose. That is, it should not be used in situations where the underlying implementation is not a VISA C implementation. For example, it should not be used to report VISA C warning or success status codes.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.NativeVisaException.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified VISA error code.
member.param: The underlying VISA status code of the error that occurred.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.NativeVisaException.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified message and VISA error code.
member.param: The underlying VISA status code of the error that occurred.
The message that describes the error.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.NativeVisaException.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified message and VISA error code and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The underlying VISA status code of the error that occurred.
The message that describes the error.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference if no inner exception is specified.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.NativeVisaException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.
member.param: The that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The that contains contextual information about the source or destination.

member.name: M:Ivi.Visa.NativeVisaException.System#Runtime#Serialization#ISerializable#GetObjectData(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Sets the with information about the exception.

member.name: P:Ivi.Visa.NativeVisaException.ErrorCode
member.summary: The underlying VISA status code of the error that occurred. The standard error code values are defined by the NativeErrorCode class.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.IOProtocol
member.summary: Indicates which protocol to use. Choices are dependent on the session.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.IOProtocol.Normal
member.summary: Normal protocol. May be used with all session types. For VXI, this indicates word serial protocol.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.IOProtocol.Fdc
member.summary: Fast data channel (FDC) protocol. May be used with VXI session types.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.IOProtocol.HS488
member.summary: GPIB high-speed (HS-488) protocol. May be used with GPIB and GPIB-VXI session types.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.IOProtocol.Ieee4882
member.summary: Use IEEE 488.2 strings to send certain meta-messages. May be used with Serial and TCPIP SOCKET session types. May not be used with GPIB or TCPIP INSTR session types.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.IOProtocol.UsbTmcVendor
member.summary: A USBTMC vendor-specific protocol. May be used with USB session types.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.VxiTriggerProtocol
member.summary: Indicates the trigger protocol to be used when a VXI trigger is asserted.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.VxiTriggerProtocol.Software
member.summary: Sends the word serial trigger command.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.VxiTriggerProtocol.On
member.summary: Turns the associated trigger line on.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.VxiTriggerProtocol.Off
member.summary: Turns the associated trigger line off.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.VxiTriggerProtocol.Sync
member.summary: Turns the associated trigger line on, then off.

member.name: T:Ivi.Visa.VxiCommandMode

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.VxiCommandMode.Command16Bit
member.summary: Send a 16-bit Word Serial command.

member.summary: Send a 32-bit Word Serial command.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.VxiCommandMode.CommandResponse32Bit
member.summary: Send a 32-bit Word Serial command and get a 32-bit response.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.VxiCommandMode.Response16Bit
member.summary: Get a 16-bit response from a previous query.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.VxiCommandMode.Response32Bit
member.summary: Get a 32-bit response from a previous query.

member.name: F:Ivi.Visa.VxiUtilitySignal.DeassertSystemFailure
member.summary: Deasserts the SYSFAIL utility bus signal.
